questionTitle: 1. In 1938, when Benny Goodman?s orchestra presented a concert at the prestigious Carnegie Hall, ___ was clear that jazz had at last been fully accepted
Duke Ellington was a composer, conductor, and pianist ___ ranked as one of the greatest of all jazz figures
Some of the rainwater from clouds evaporates before ________.
_______ are prepared from flour or meal derived from some form of grain.
Rhododendrons would rather ________ in shady places, and so would azaleas.
The janitor refused to unlock the classroom door because he ________ busy.
The more hemoglobin one has, the more oxygen is carried to ________ cells.
Before the Angles and the Saxons ________ to England, the Iberians had lived there.
Neither Jane nor her brothers ________a consent form for tomorrow's field trip.
Children usually turn to their parents rather than ________ for protection from threats in the environment.
anwers: they turn to other figures of authority
their turning to other figures of authority

questionTitle: ________ the last lunar eclipse lasting longer than any this century, we were able to try out our new telescope.
Henry Ford revolutionized production management by ________ into small steps on a moving line.
The javelin used in competition must be between 260 and 270 centimeters ________
________ created the donkey and elephant that symbolize the Democratic and Republican parties.
John Dewey advocated teaching methods that provided teaching experiences for students to participate in ________ material to memorize.
John walked by the professor's office ________ would be in.
________ jellies, jams are made by retaining the pulp with the fruit juice.
In the seventeenth century, North America was vast and unconquered, ________ only at great cost.
anwers: it promised riches but yielded its bounty
promising riches but yielding its bounty
by promising riches but by yielding its bounty
its riches were promised but its bounty yielded

questionTitle: Some monkeys, ________, use their tails in a way similar to a hand.
________ the intermission, the kids all bought popcorn.
